intro: Periphanes karooica, commonly known as the Karoo bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Periphanes karooica is often found in the Karoo region, where it thrives in open, sunny habitats.
